adjectives.description: titanic (not generally comparable, comparative more titanic, superlative most titanic)

entries.meaning: (not comparable) Of or relating to the Titans, a race of giant gods in Greek mythology.
(comparable) Having great size, or great force, power, or strength.
(not comparable) Of a conflict or contest: involving equally powerful participants.

description: From titan(ium) +‎ -ic (suffix meaning ‘of or pertaining to’ forming adjectives from nouns), in the case of sense 1 (“of or relating to titanium”) modelled after French titanique.

entries.meaning: (inorganic chemistry) Of or relating to titanium, especially tetravalent titanium.
(mineralogy) Of a mineral, especially iron ore: containing titanium, or from which titanium may be extracted.
